intro: Phyllanthus subterblancus, commonly known as the white sand phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Despite its ornamental value, it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
